article_desc:
VR videos deliver a powerful way to share and experience the world.

From going behind the curtain with Cirque du Soleil , to diving into iconic pieces of art , to a behind-the-scenes studio tour with a TV super star, you can transport your viewers to experience moments as if they’re actually there.

We’ve heard that you want to make and see even more immersive videos on YouTube.

That’s why we’re continuing to expand the ways anyone can create and watch VR content.

More ways to watch YouTube VR With all the great content that’s available on YouTube today, we want to continue our effort to bring the YouTube VR app to everyone with a VR headset.

Starting today, the app will be available on Oculus Go headsets via the Oculus Store .

Making it easier to create VR180 content Last year we introduced VR180, a new video format that focuses on what’s in front of the camera while delivering a 3D effect in a VR headset.

By focusing only on the 180-degree view of what’s in front of the camera, it made VR video production easier for creators like you, encouraging more VR videos than ever before.

Since then we’ve introduced new tools to make this type of video creation even easier.

We launched the VR180 Creator Tool that makes it faster to process footage, add metadata and publish.

The tool is available on MacOS, Linux and now on Windows.

With the latest editing tools from Adobe, it’s also significantly easier for you to edit, add effects and publish your content.

And with new VR180 capable cameras from Kandao and Vuze , you now have more options for capturing VR180 to complement cameras from Z-Cam Lenovo Creating more immersive VR videos Spatial audio can help make haunted houses more scary and imaginary video game worlds more real.

That’s because it matches realistic sounds and picture together for a more immersive experience.

We’ve recently added support for head-locked audio, which means that you can add narration and background music that will sound the same no matter where you look.

VR videos unlock a world of experiences.

With new and easier ways to create and watch VR content, we look forward to seeing what stories you tell, locations you transport viewers to and experiences you uncover.
article_title: New ways to create and watch VR videos

article_desc:
3X GRAMMY Award-winning, multi-Platinum recording artist Olivia Rodrigo is back with her sure-to-be monstrous new single “vampire” off her forthcoming album GUTS and is bringing fans along for this exciting new chapter with the exclusive YouTube Shorts #vampireOR2 challenge.

“I’m excited for ‘vampire’ to finally be out! Creating visual representations of my music is important to me and that’s why I decided to put the song out into the world with this music video and Shorts campaign.

I’m so grateful for my fans and can’t wait to see what they create for #vampireOR2, ” shared Rodrigo.

Tonight, Rodrigo joined excited fans and YouTube Creators in Los Angeles to unveil #vampireOR2 and to premiere the highly anticipated music video for the single, directed by Petra Collins.

The superstar sealed the experience with a kiss, giving everyone a first look at her own take on kiss-transition content featuring “vampire” to kick off the #vampireOR2 Shorts challenge .

The fans and creators joined in on the fun, going full “vampire” on site and immediately sharing their personal spin on Shorts.

More photos from the premiere event are here ! Written with collaborator Daniel Nigro, “vampire” is Rodrigo’s first new music since the May 2021 release of her debut album SOUR .

entered the Billboard 200 at No.

1 and would go on to become the longest-running debut album in the chart’s top 10 of the 21st century.

Rodrigo’s breakout hit “ drivers license ” charted in more than 50 markets on YouTube, reaching #1 on the Top Songs charts in countries including the U.S., Canada, South Africa, Australia and the United Kingdom, and every song from charted on the US Top Songs chart.

Since her debut, she’s earned over 4 billion views on YouTube and amassed more than 10 million subscribers on her official YouTube channel.

More Shorts surprises are in store for the weeks ahead as Rodrigo invites Livies worldwide to create and share their best kiss-transition-themed content to join the Shorts #vampireOR2 movement.

It’s your move Livies! How to participate in the YouTube Shorts #vampireOR2 challenge: To start, check out Olivia’s very own Shorts and sink your teeth in by heading to YouTube and creating Shorts of your own: Head to YouTube, hit the ‘+’ sign followed by “Create a Short” Click “Add sound” and search for “vampire” Hit the red circle to begin recording your video Record your best kiss-transition take and add the hashtag #vampireOR2 as part of your caption Hit publish! Stay tuned to Olivia Rodrigo’s official YouTube channel for more #vampireOR2 action to come!
article_title: Olivia Rodrigo’s “vampire” is finally here
